snippet: Travel agencies, normally closed on Fridays, were open and busy, and even with extra flights there was often not a seat to be had.
abstract: Baghdad residents rush to book flights away from the city in response to threat from Islamic State in Iraq and Syria militants; while many other businesses are closed, travel agencies are open and busy, but even with extra flights, every seat on outgoing flights is booked.
lead_paragraph: Travel agencies, normally closed on Fridays, were open and busy, and even with extra flights there was often not a seat to be had.

headline.main: In Baghdad, Where ‘Hello’ Means Goodbye, Hellos Abound at Travel Agencies
headline.print_headline: In Baghdad, Where ‘Hello’ Means Goodbye, Hellos Abound at Travel Agencies

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
